alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 9:01AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Expected Along the Yukon River... The National Weather Service has observed on satellite imagery an ice jam on the Yukon River located approximately 7 miles upriver from Grayling. The Yukon River is flowing overbank upriver from the ice jam and flooding low lying areas east of the river. Residents in Grayling, Anvik, Holy Cross, and Russian Mission will see a rapid rise in water levels when the ice jam releases. At this time, flooding is not expected in these communities but water levels may rise to bankfull in some locations along with bank to bank runs of ice moving downriver. Residents area encouraged to monitor water levels as the breakup front moves through this reach of the Yukon River and move items to higher ground.
